ip_filtering.description: Define the sets of IP addresses that can access your injixo tenant.
ip_filtering.enter_ip_addresses_message: Enter an IP address range, e.g. {{validatedRemoteIpAddress}}/32. To access injixo, your IP address must be within one of these IP address ranges. If you do not use IP address ranges, you can add individual IP addresses, e.g. {{validatedRemoteIpAddress}}.

field_errors.invalid_ip_address: Enter an IP address range in the CIDR format.

ip_filtering.heading: IP filtering

submit.success: The IP address ranges were saved.

submit_errors.ip_address_out_of_range: Your IP address is not part of the IP address range. You cannot log in with this IP address. Enter an IP address that is part of the range.
submit_errors.submission_failed: The IP address(es) could not be saved. Please try again.

ip_filtering.submit_warning: If you save these changes, all users in your organization will be logged out. Log in again to continue working with injixo.

disabled.description1: Currently, 2FA is optional and each person can choose whether to activate or deactivate 2FA.
disabled.description2: If you enforce 2FA for all people, they have to activate 2FA upon their next login. Otherwise, they cannot log in. Learn more in <0>Help Center</0>.

enabled.description1: 2FA is currently enforced for all people.
enabled.description2: People can only log in with 2FA. Learn more in <0>Help Center</0>.

two_factor_auth.error_message: There was a technical problem. Please try again.
two_factor_auth.heading: Two-factor authentication (2FA)
two_factor_auth.sso_enforced: Single sign-on is enforced, and 2FA is not available in injixo. Set up a second authentication factor through your identity provider instead.

single_sign_on.description: injixo supports single sign-on (SSO) based on SAML 2.0. Logging in with SSO will skip injixo's two-factor authentication. Your identity provider (IdP) may provide 2FA instead. Learn more in <0>Help Center</0>.

disable_confirmation.consequences: The SSO login is no longer available for your injixo account. All users will get instructions via email on how to proceed.
disable_confirmation.failed_message: The link from your email is not valid. Please go to Account > Security and disable SSO again.
disable_confirmation.next_step: To continue, set a new password on the next page.

enforced.2fa_hint: We highly recommend activating 2FA as an additional layer of security afterwards.
enforced.details: After disabling, each user has to login via email and password. They will get instructions via email on how to create a new password.
enforced.next_step: To confirm disabling SSO we will send an email to <0>{{email}}</0> with detailed instructions on how to proceed.

result.accepted: We just sent you an email to confirm deactivating SSO.
result.disabled: SSO successfully deactivated. All users have to login via email and password again.

unenforced.details: As SSO was not yet enforced, you can simply disable it. Logging in with SSO won’t be possible anymore. Every user has to use the normal login with email and password. Users will not receive any notification.

single_sign_on.enforced: Single sign-on is active. The login with email and password is no longer available. Users can only log in to injixo if they have the relevant permissions in the identity provider. Learn more in <0>Help Center</0>.

enforcement.description: Enforce SSO after you have successfully tested your configuration above. This will disable login via email and password and all users have to use SSO.

modal.generic_error: An unknown error occurred. Try again later.

preconditions.item_1: All users must have appropriate permissions within your Identity provider to access injixo. If not, they won’t be able to log in to injixo.
preconditions.title: Preconditions

related_changes.item_1: Each user will be informed via email, that they have to use SSO from then on.
related_changes.item_2: Logging in with email and password will not be possible any longer.
related_changes.item_3: All user passwords will be reset after a grace period of 48 hours.
related_changes.item_4: injixo 2FA will no longer be available. You might want to ensure that your IdP requests a second factor to authenticate.
related_changes.item_5: User passwords have to be managed in the IdP.
related_changes.title: Implications

modal.title: Enforce SSO for all users

enforcement.not_enforced_warning: Not enforcing SSO should just be temporary in order to test your setup and configuration.
enforcement.success: Successfully enforced SSO for all users.

identity_provider.description: Obtain the following information from your IdP, e.g. Microsoft Azure AD or Okta.

injixo_metadata.description: Upload the following metadata file (.xml) to your IdP to configure injixo as valid Service Provider.

token_encryption.description:
Certificate to encrypt SAML assertions.
Valid until <0>{{expiration_date}}</0>.
Six weeks before the end of the validity period, you can download the new certificate here.

verification.details: All users have to be assigned to the injixo SAML application in your IdP. SSO can then be used in parallel to the normal login with email and password.
verification.error: Your IdP does not allow you to access injixo. Make sure your IdP is set up correctly and your user account is allowed to authenticate for injixo via SSO.
verification.success: You successfully authenticated against your IdP and are allowed to access injixo via SSO.
